description:
Failed to create a instance into a server group with affinity policy and the retry  filter is enabled. The scheduler selected a host,
say it's  'host2', but the host2's hypervisor has some problems and failed to boot the instance. Then scheduler retry to boot the instance. Scheduler failed to select host for the instance. As the group with affinity request boot instance to host2 but host2 is not OK.

For this case, it's not make sense that the group affinity policy take effect when the first instance in the group is retrying to create.
title: Fail to create instance to a server group with affinity policy.

comments.content: I think this is actually working as intended. If you have told the instance it can only go on a certain host, and that host failed, it should fail.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Sorry that I didn't describe the bug clearly. If there is instance in the server group, then  boot an instance into the server group. If the group host fail  to boot instance. This is OK.

But my case is the first instance in the server group failed. To the end user, the server group is  actually no instance(or host).
Retry should pick up another host to boot instance and take the new host as group host.

Failed to boot the first instance in the group doesn't make sense.
